chapter.title: Emergency KSK Rollover (KSK Compromise)
chapter.para: The emergency procedures described for key roll-over use the rationale that injection of valid but false data (which can be generated using the compromised key) is more serious than discontinuity in our ability to validate true data. Thus, during emergency KSK roll-over, there will be a period (up to twice the maximum zone TTL) where it may not be possible to build an "authentication chain" from the zone data to the new KSK.
The DNSSEC-Tools utilities do not currently handle emergency KSK rollover. However, the utilities may be used to automate some of the steps required.

section.title: Emergency Current KSK Rollover Using DNSSEC-Tools
section.para: The steps given below detail the steps that must be taken during emergency KSK rollover when using DNSSEC-Tools to assist in rollover.

section.title: Inform Parent about the KSK Compromise
section.para: This communication between parent and child must be done securely using out-of-band mechanisms.

section.title: Wait for the Parent to Remove the Zone's DS Record
section.para: Before proceeding, wait for the parent zone to remove the DS record. This may be determined by using the dig command to retrieve the parent's DS record.

para.computeroutput: :: flags: qr aa rd: QUERY: 1, ANSWER: 0, AUTHORITY: 1, ADDITIONAL : 0

section.title: Stop Automatic Zone Rollover
section.para: The rollerd command must not be executing during this procedure.

section.title: Generate New Keys
section.para: Since the KSK has been compromised it must be regenerated. In addition, the ZSKs can no longer be trusted so they too must be regenerated. This may be done with a single zonesigner execution.

section.title: Fix the Keyrec File
section.para: The zonesigner command in the previous step will have left the compromised zone's keyrec file in an inconsistent state. Consequently, the keyrec file must be edited to return it to a valid state.
The steps below should be followed to fix the keyrec file for the KSK keys.

listitem.para: Find the name of the zone's keyrec file. This may be done with the following command:
Find the name of the zone's Current KSK. Look for the zone keyrec entry for the compromised zone, and find its ksk entry. This holds the name of the KSK.
Edit the keyrec file and search for all key keyrec entries with a keyrec_type of "ksk". Any keys with this type that are not the Current KSK should be given the type "kskobs".

section.para: The steps below should be followed to fix the keyrec file for the Current ZSK keys.

listitem.para: Find the name of the zone's keyrec file. This may be done with the following command:
Find the name of the zone's Current ZSK signing set. Look for the zone keyrec entry for the compromised zone, and find its zskcur entry. This holds the name of the Current ZSK signing set.

Get the names of the keys in the Current ZSK signing set. Look for the set keyrec entry for the Current ZSK signing set. The keys listed in that set's keys entry are the ZSK keys in the Current ZSK signing set.
Edit the keyrec file and search for all key keyrec entries with a keyrec_type of "zskcur". Any keys with this type that are not in the Current signing set should be given the type "zskobs".

section.para: The steps below should be followed to fix the keyrec file for the Published KSK keys.

listitem.para: Find the name of the zone's keyrec file. This may be done with the following command:
Find the name of the zone's Published signing set. Look for the zone keyrec entry for the compromised zone, and find its zskpub entry. This holds the name of the Published ZSK signing set.

Get the names of the keys in the Published signing set. Look for the set keyrec entry for the Published ZSK signing set. The keys listed in that set's keys entry are the ZSK keys in the Published ZSK signing set.
Edit the keyrec file and search for all key keyrec entries with a keyrec_type of "zskpub". Any keys with this type that are not in the Published signing set should be given the type "zskobs".

section.title: Perform Steps in Section ??? if this Zone is a Secure Delegation from Another Zone
section.para: Send the keyset generated from the zone-signing process in Section ??? to the parent in order to complete the secure delegation.

section.title: Reload the Zone
section.para: The rndc will reload the name server configuration files and the zone contents. The name server process is assumed to be already running.

section.title: Dispose of the Old Zone Key
section.para: Delete the old ZSK's .private and .key files.

section.title: Restart Automatic Zone Rollover
section.para: Automatic rollover may be restarted by executing the rollerd command. It should be given the same options as when it was originally started.

section.title: Manual Emergency Current KSK Rollover
section.para: The steps given below detail the manual steps that must be taken during emergency KSK rollover.

section.title: Inform Parent about the KSK Compromise
section.para: This communication between parent and child must be done securely using out-of-band mechanisms.

section.title: Wait for the Parent to Remove the Zone's DS Record
section.para: Before proceeding, wait for the parent zone to remove the DS record. This may be determined by using the dig command to retrieve the parent's DS record.

section.title: Generate a New KSK
section.para: Follow the steps in Section ??? for generation of a new KSK. Update the Key-Tag Table with the new KSK. Delete the Current KSK. Karm the status of the New KSK as Current (C).

section.title: Modify the Zone File
section.para: The zone file must be modified to account for the key changes. The Current KSK must be deleted and the New KSK must be added. Also, the SOA serial number must be incremented so that the zone file's new contents will be recognized.
The required key changes are made by modifying the $INCLUDE lines at the end of the file. The $INCLUDE line for the Current KSK must be deleted. An $INCLUDE line for the New KSK must be added.

section.title: Regenerate the ZSKs
section.para: The ZSKs can no longer be trusted. Follow the steps in Sections ??? and ??? to create the new Current ZSK and Published ZSK.

section.title: Sign the Zone with the Current KSK and Current ZSK
section.para: Follow the steps in Sections ??? - ??? if the zone does no delegation. Follow the steps in Sections ??? - ??? if the zone does delegation. The ZSK used in the signing process in Section ??? or ??? must be the key that is marked as the Current key (C) in the Key-Tag table. The KSK is the new key which has been marked with the status Current (C).

section.title: Perform Steps in Section ??? if this Zone is a Secure Delegation from Another Zone
section.para: Send the keyset generated from the zone-signing process in Section ??? to the parent in order to complete the secure delegation.

section.para: The rndc will reload the name server configuration files and the zone contents. The name server process is assumed to be already running.

section.para: Delete the old ZSK's .private and .key files.
